text: A tumbler of Scotch. A half empty bottle of Macallan's. A burning Montecristo cigar in an ashtray. A hand picks up a telephone and dials.
I'd like to speak with my wife.
(groggy) ; ; Barney...? It's three in the morning.
Put my wife on the phone.
She's not your wife and I'm not waking her.

Then just ask her what she wants me to do with these nude photos I have of her. Come to think of it, you might actually want them if only to see what Miriam looked like in her prime. Click. Dial tone. Barney hangs up, puffs on his cigar. Feeling good. Photos of him and Miriam strewn over the table. None of them nud

The bottle of Macallan's now empty. The cigar burned to t An ALARM CLOCK DRONES on and on from the bedroom. It fina gets turned off. BARNEY PANOFSKY (64), hung over and in his robe, lumbers down the hallway and to the front door.
He picks up the morning newspaper. Scans the front page. Something he reads upsets him.
Fuck. A SOCCER BALL rolls and stops at Barney's feet.  WHITE 10-23-09 2. JUSTIN (8) runs up and grabs the ball. He stares up at Barney. Barney stares back
Justin, come on, we're late.
Hi Barney.
Good morning. Justin runs off. Barney turns back inside.
Now dressed, Barney reads the paper as he finishes his ba and lox. He looks at his watch -- shit, he's late. Drops the paper on the table. Puts the dishes in the sink.
"BOOK REVIEW: Detective Sean O'Hearne writes his own acco of the scandal that rocked the city 30 years ago..." Beside the blurb is an old picture of BARNEY IN HANDCUFFS

He grabs his cell phone and turns it on, then notices the answering machine. INSERT - BLINKING ANSWERING MACHINE: 10 MESSAGES. He presses PLAY, but only listens to the first few words each message before fast forwarding to the next.
(female voice) Hi dad, I know it's early... hi dad, me again... where are you... dad, call meeee... The next few messages from an angry MALE VOICE.
Dad, its Michael.... Dad, I know you're there... Are you screening?... Barney turns the machine OFF. Now he can't find his keys. Scours the house for them. His cell phone RINGS.
Hello?
INTERCUT WITH KATE (24), Barney's daughter. Walking to he job as a grade school teacher, carrying a bag and thermos
Daddy, where were you? I've been calling all morning.
The ringer was off.
Blair had a heart attack last night.
Really?
Really.
How bad?
Minor. He thought it was indigestion.
Putz. He finds his keys. Rushes out the door
Dad, it's still a heart attack.
Barney hurries down the hallway to the elevator.
That's true. The long term effects of these things don't often show up until later. Impotence is still on the table.
Are you not at all concerned that you might have caused this?
Why would I be?
Mom told me about the phone call last night.  WHITE 10-23-09 4. That triggers a distant alcohol fogged memory. DING. The elevator arrives. He steps in.
I'll call you back. I'm stepping in the elevator.
You better. Barney grins from ear to ear, filled with glee at this ne On the elevator doors closing we...
Barney driving his Mercedes, back on the phone with Kate is approaching the school she teaches at.
I may have accidentally dialed their number.

Sure, dad. But you do have an out - it seems that Blair was already having chest pains when you called but he didn't want to bother mom with it. It was your call that woke her, and she then insisted on taking him to the hospital.
So I saved his life.
My hero.
Did you see the paper today?
I did. Are you okay?
Yeah, I'm fine. (beat) I'll call you later.
Okay. Love you.
Love you too.  WHITE 10-23-09 5.
Barney drives up to the offices of TOTALLY UNNECESSARY PRODUCTIONS and pulls into his personal parking spot.

We drop right into a scene of Barney's TV show, the long running soap - "O'MALLEY OF THE NORTH". The CONSTABLE, O'MALLEY, mid-50's and still handsome, is being tended to by a female NURSE played by SOLANGE (52), making a "house call" to the local bar.
(wrapping a bandage) How does that feel, O'Malley?

Warm and tight. SOLANGE, originally cast as the "sexpot" of the show, her uniform is inappropriately low cut and tight for a woman age, but she works it like she's still the cat's meow. Barney quietly walks onto the sound stage, and sits in hi producers chair. The scene is painful for him watch. He pulls over a WARDROBE GIRL.
Can we do something about her outfit?
I tried. She has them altered herself.
(to Barney) How was that?
Appallingly bad.
Great. MOVING ON. Solange's bright smile instantly sours as she eyes Barney
I want to talk to you! Barney immediately hustles himself away.

Don't you run away from me! She tries to go after him but is stopped by the sound guy who needs to remove her mic. FOUR EXECUTIVES descend upon him, struggling to keep pace including MARK (40). Everyone talking over each other
Did you see today's We need to go over the paper? opening for next week's episode.
The teaser is a minute And we lost the location long- - so we have to rewrite it for the studio-- Barney pushes through a door, leading everyone into --
Rows of desks occupied by accountants, story editors assistants. Barney whisks through the aisles - everyone still hot on his tail.
(announcing to entire office) Good morning everyone. Yes I've seen today's paper, no I don't give a flying fuck and neither should you, let that be the end of it.
Barney, the network wants to make a really big deal about the 30th season.
That's in a year.
They're looking ahead, and they're open to renewing for two more seasons. (nervous) But they have a few suggestions.
How long have you worked for me?
Eighteen years.
So why do you still act like a girl asking permission for a sleepover? Tell me what the hell it is. Barney heads into --
The exec's all follow inside and stand in silence. Mark steps forward as Barney flips through mail on his desk.
They want to bring in a new face. Someone young. Maybe give Solange a sexy, young niece who comes to live with her--
They want to fire Solange?
They want us to write her down in favor of a new character
No. No way.
We'll do it in a classy way--
I won't humiliate her like that. She's been on the show since day one. I'll give her your job before that happens.
They're not asking. If we don't do it, this is our last season. No one under fifty watches the show.
So they want to bring in some tits and ass?
Isn't that why you first hired her? Solange suddenly bursts through the crowd of Exec's and s a FOLDER down on Barney's desk.
I want a word with you NOW.
Barney opens the folder and scans the papers inside.
What language is this?
They're from Bulgaria. Press clippings about me and they just keep coming. They love me over there. This proves what I'm really worth to the foreign market. Barney tosses the folder aside.
I'll give it my utmost attention.
I hired a new lawyer, a real shark and he says--
Whoa, whoa, Solange, why do we need to bring lawyers into this? Solange turns around and pushes the Exec's out.
Out! I want to talk Barney alone.
Barney, we have to discuss--
She slams the door on them and turns to Barney. instantly softens.
I feel like everyone is laughing at me. Tell me honestly, how do I look? Beat.
You look like the reason we're still on the air. Sexy as hell.
(teary) Thank you. (beat) But you're still going to pay me what I deserve. Her tone  WHITE 10-23-09 9. She stops just before exiting.
I saw the paper. How are you doing?

Fine. Not wanting to get into it, Barney busies himself with mo around papers. Solange takes the cue, then takes a deep breath, puts her game face on and storms out, slamming th door behind her for effect.
Barney drives through downtown Montreal, eventually parki in front of Grumpy's Bar
Barney walks into his regular watering hole - GRUMPY'S BA The bar spotted with regulars who mumble hello to him. JILL THE BARTENDER serves him his usual.
You get home okay last night?
I got home. With a glance, Jill directs Barney down the bar.
He's had more than a few already. DETECTIVE SEAN O'HEARNE, around 60, slides off his barsto Grossly overweight, blotchy salmon red complexion.
You see that review in the paper today? Not bad. Barney ignores him. O'Hearne places a copy of the infamou book he's written "WITH FRIENDS LIKE THESE" on the bar

That's for you. I even signed it. Barney opens the book - dumps a handful of peanuts on the page, POUNDS it shut with his fist, then flips it back op and starts eating from the cracked nuts.  WHITE 10-23-09 10.
Why do you have to be like that? I wrote a nice little note to you. O'Hearne slides the book back over to himself and clumsil flips to his hand written inscription. He's very drunk.
"To Barney, none of this would have been possible without you. All the best, Detective Sean O'Hearne".
What the hell are you doing here?
This is a big day. I thought I'd buy you a drink, share in the moment, be a "mensch", like you might say. Barney looks at O'Hearne. Marvelling at his idiocy.
For someone who professes to hate me so much, you sure do go out of your way to come around here a lot.
I just want to know what you did with the body already.
You really want to know? Fine. I carved him up with a chainsaw, dumped the parts in the St. Lawrence river
Chainsaw, my ass. You'd never have the guts to cut him up. If you won't tell me now, promise you'll at least leave me a note in your will.
C'mon O'Hearne, you're bound to go first. Look at you - prick you with a fork on a hot summer day and you'd explode like a pan fried sausage.
This heart will still be pumping strong when your prostate turns to marble, Panofsky.  WHITE 10-23-09 11.
Why don't you just leave him alone already?

Because he got away with murder, sweetie. (looking at Barney) You screwed over everyone you ever knew or cared about, and now the whole world is going to know what a cocksucking murderer you really are. O'Hearne is right up in his face. INTENSE stare.
Your breath stinks. O'Hearne has to tear himself away before he tries to kill Barney. He slides the book back over to him.

It's a real page turner. O'Hearne marches out. Barney's eyes reluctantly drift to the COVER PHOTO of the book INSERT - BLACK AND WHITE PHOTO CIRCA 1974, Barney with hi arm around his best friend BOOGIE.

Barney is out cavorting with his crew - over educated contemporaries living the bohemian life in Rome. Barney's Algonquin Round Table. Copious amounts of food and drink. Lively conversations overlap, as we move around a crowded table. Locals, ex-pa and plenty of girls. A few of Barney's standout friends b CEDRIC RICHARDSON, African American, actor, extremely han three fawning girls with him. LEO FASOLI, Italian bearded artist, his pants and t-shirt speckled with paint.
...I know that I can't just sit around and wait for something to happen. (MORE )

So I call up the director and tell him: "I've been offered Othello for the third straight year and I'm not going to pass it up just to play the fucking Chuck Wagon cook again. Who do I look like, Roscoe Lee Brown? "But that's how it's written" he answers. So I tell him - "Roberto, the time has come for the black man to hold a gun instead of a spatula".
Amen!
And he had the role rewritten for me. I am now posse member number 4.
To Cedric, living the lessons of the Bard: "be as great in act, as you have in thought". Everyone toasts. Barney's eyes light up as he leaps from his chair to greet --

Boogie/Welcome back! ! BOOGIE, Barney's best and most cherished friend. Tall and lean, he possesses a physical and intellectual magnetism that enchants everyone who meets him. He has a stunning g (THE COUNTESS) on his arm. Boogie is greeted by all and handed some wine. Cedric mak it a point to introduce himself to The Countess.
I'm Cedric.
Maria. (flirtatious) You look familiar to me.
I'm an actor.

I knew it. You look like a movie star.  WHITE 10-23-09 13. The Countess then slides up to Boogie, whispers something his ear, kisses him deeply, then walks off to the bathroo Her exquisite beauty silences them all.
Who is that?
Ah, the Countess. A descendant of Giuseppe Garibaldi, no less.
Where did you meet her?

Somewhere between my blackout in Lake Como and my hangover in Ste- Maxime. If you could find out AND get her name, that would be great. But enough about that, I want to hear about all of you. Leo, how was your showing at Galerie Des Points? The silence around the table indicates - "not so good".
His work is too bold for that crowd.
The show was a bust. I only sold one piece - to Barney. Barney holds up the painting to show Boogie.
Barney - our very own patron of the arts. Otherwise known as our only friend with a real job. Everyone toasts.
(to Barney) And so, my High Priest, did you get through those books I sent you?
A few of them.
Only a few? I sent them months ago. What have you been doing with yourself?
Well, actually, I'm getting married.  WHITE 10-23-09 14.
What?! To who?

To me. Boogie turns around to find CLARA CHAMBERS (26), tall, sk pale and beautiful, gypsy shawl and skirt. Three months pregnant, and slightly showing at her belly. She downs a shot of Grappa and lights a cigarette as she sits.
Prince Charmingbaum here knocked me up by way of a magical thirty seconds of friction.
Where have you been? You didn't come home last night.
Who remembers? (to Boogie) Has he told you what he's doing now? Exporting olive oil to some guy, Hymie back in Montreal. It's like a bad Jewish sitcom.
Someone needs to make a living.
He comes to Europe and sells oil. It's fucking humiliating. You're not one of us. You're a voyeur--
Okay, A toast to the newlyweds! To your health, your happiness- -
(at Barney) And a three inch prick
Everyone drinks. Barney scowls at Clara. She instantly switches gears to soft and loving.
I'm sorry, baby. You're still my yummy yid.  WHITE 10-23-09 15. She gets on his lap, curling herself around him like a ca He starts to soften, the party around them continues on..
Closing down the bar, the whole gang pours out into the street. Barney and Boogie lead the way, sharing a flask Barney shlepping Leo's painting with him.
Why did you agree to marry her?
I got her pregnant.
So? Clara's crazy. She's a conversation piece, not a wife. And how do you even know it's yours?
It's mine.
If you say so. Boogie turns to the gang: Leo pulling up the rear with hi girl. Cedric walking with one arm around Clara and the ot around the Countess, who is quite smitten with him.
So what's the plan everyone? What are we doing?
I have an early call time tomorrow.
Yeah, I'm exhausted.
Oh, come on. TI don't believe what I'm seeing.
(lighting a cigarette) Count me out. I'm already hung over and I'm not even done being drunk yet. Oh, yeah, and I'm fucking pregnant too. C'mon, Barney.
He's coming with me.  WHITE 10-23-09 16.
Where are you going?
Taking him out for a proper bachelor party.
Oh no, you're not.
You don't own him just yet. Boogie drags Barney down a side street.
Got any money?
Some. Why?
Provisions.

Laid out on the table in Boogie's hotel room: A bottle of Scotch, two packs of Gauloises, a pack of rol papers, a small ball of TINFOIL. Barney finds two clean glasses in the messy room and pour them each a drink. Boogie unwraps the tinfoil to reveal a ball of OPIUM inside. Then gathers his drug paraphernalia

We have to do it all, Barney. Opium, Horse, Hash - everything under and behind the sun, on and off the table. We only go around once. They toast and drink. Boogie then hands Barney a thick MANUSCRIPT off the floor
You finished it?!
Not quite yet. But you can read it so far. Barney drops onto the mattress and starts right away.

text: Barney has gone through a hundred pages so far
Boogie, this is brilliant. Absolutely brilliant. When are they publishing it?
They're not.
Why?
I didn't submit it.
Why the hell not?
I told you, it's not finished yet. And anyway, I'm never giving it to that feckless editor.
What about the advance they paid you?
I wrote him another one.
Which? Boogie reaches over and tosses Barney a manuscript.
What's it about? While Boogie weaves his tale, he heats up and crumbles so of the Opium, preparing to smoke it in a pipe.

It's a new interpretation of the Book of Job, as told through Vanessa's vaginal lips. Pious and pristine Vanessa's Pussy is a pillar of religious devotion. Then one day, without warning or reason, Vanessa's Pussy is suddenly fucked over and over and over again by The Supreme Being; a deity who erects himself into this temporal world as The Great Cock. After an ungodly amount of (MORE )

drilling, and now a shell of the hole she used to be, Vanessa's Pussy surrenders her absolute devotion to The Great Cock. As reward, her elasticity is restored, but she's left with a recurring odorous rash. (beat) For some reason the editor passed. Barney looks at him dumfounded.
Let me guess - Vanessa is the editor's wife.
Was. Boogie takes a hit off the pipe. Barney tries to stare hi down like a disapproving parent, but the sheer bravado of the story makes them both crack up.
Jesus, Boogie, stop dicking around and finish your book already. Barney pours himself more Scotch and continues reading.

Wedding day. Boogie, Cedric, Leo accompany Barney and Cla up the steps to the Mayor's Marriage Office. Clara is seven months pregnant, wearing a black veil. Ced helps her up the stairs. Barney wears a mix and match tuxedo. He and Boogie walk ahead of the others.
Listen, you don't have to go through with this.
You're saying this to me now?
I'm just saying, no one will think anything less of you.  WHITE 10-23-09 19.
(beat ) C'mon, we're already late.
Everyone waits for the JUDGE who looks over their paperwo (JUDGE'S DIALOGUE IS IN ITALIAN AND SUBTITLED).
I vistri passaporti, prego The Judge takes a cursory glance and hands them to his CL
I testimoni, prego - Bernardo Moscovitz, Leonardo Fasoli. Boogie and Leo step forward and sign the marriage license
Barney Panofsky, firmi qui. Barney signs.
Clara Charnofksy, firmi qui.
(in bad Italian) Charnofsky? No, is chiama Clara Chambers.
Non secondo il suo passaporto. Clara says nothing. Barney grabs her passport to see for himself.
I was married to a Russian gangster for maybe five days. I ran away on the honeymoon. I just never bothered to do the paperwork to change the name back.
Did you not think to mention this?
Don't worry, you still got yourself a true blue Shiksa.  WHITE 10-23-09 20.
What else haven't you told me? Any kids I don't know about?

Only two - Yosel and Chaim. They're locked in our attic. When you're out getting the hockey scores I let them down and force feed them pork roast milkshakes through a funnel. Dumfounded silence. Then -- Clara SNATCHES the pen from Barney's hand and signs the license in a flash.
There.
(beat) Mazel Tov!

THUNDER and LIGHTENING rage outside. Barney holds Clara in his arms as she is curled on the be clutching her black wedding veil, trembling with white kn fear; a child terrified of the thunder. All around the apartment we see scraps of half written po sketches and paintings.
I'm sorry. (beat) You still love your crazy Clara, don't you?
(beat) Of course. (beat) Can I get you anything? You haven't eaten a thing all day.
Maybe a piece of fruit. Barney reaches over and hands her a BANANA off the table. Clara begins to peel it from the WRONG END.
Why do you peel it like that?  WHITE 10-23-09 21.
I read somewhere this is how monkeys do it. I figured they should know. She may be crazy, but she has her odd charms. Barney hold her tight as she flinches at another rumble of thunder
Barney runs through the halls of the hospital in Rome, frantically demanding help from the nurse's desk.
(to Nurse, in Italian) I need to find my wife - Clara Panofsky. Or Chambers. Or maybe Charnofsky.
THE DOCTOR sits down, lights up a cigarette.
Signor Panofsky - mi dispiace - I will speak in English. I am afraid the infant was a stillborn. Barney is speechless.
But your wife is healthy and will certainly be able to bear other children. (beat) I must ask if you know the biological father - for our records.
I'm the father. The doctor looks at Barney incredulously, then to his cha than back at Barney.
Then you must be an Albino.
Barney enters and sits at Clara's bedside. She's sketchin a picture of Barney on a pad as they talk. Barney won't look her in the eye.  WHITE 10-23-09 22.
Every four hours they attach clamps to my nipples and milk me like a cow. (beat) I was sure it was yours--
Can we talk about this later? Barney is visibly hurt and angry. Clara strokes his arm.
Oh Barney, you really do wear your heart on your sleeve. (beat) Now put it away, it's disgusting to look at.
(up and leaving) I'll pick you up tomorrow.
I'm not going to let you divorce me! Barney is already out the door

Barney walks down the hallway where his friends are gathe and looking somber. The Countess and Leo are consoling Cedric. Barney makes a bee-line for Cedric and SUCKER PUN him. Boogie jumps in and wrestles Barney away from Cedric
Easy, man. C'mon. He just lost a son. Barney looks at Boogie - "what the fuck?". With an incredulous grunt, he walks off.
Barney helps Clara out of a taxi and into their apartment building.
Barney helps Clara onto the bed, pours her a glass of wat
Okay, I'm ready to talk now. Barney waits.  WHITE 10-23-09 23.
I've already spoken with a lawyer. If you divorce me I'm entitled to half your income for the rest of your life.
Clara, I never knew you had such a practical streak in you.
Surprise. Not all us Shiksa's are chumps. (lights a cigarette) Look, I'm not a pig despite what you might think. I'll settle for a year's rent on this dump and an allowance of fifty dollars a week.
I'll move out tomorrow.
Oh look, the color's come back into your cheeks. Now you can finally go back home, tongue your way into proper society and find yourself a nice Jewish girl - someone who shops.
(grabbing a few clothes) As always, your insight is dazzling.

Come now, I did you a great favor. You'll be able to entertain them all at the United Jewish Appeal galas with stories about Crazy Clara Chambers before she got famous. Now get the hell out while I try and rustle up a proper fuck. Barney walks out and never looks back.
Clara runs out and screams down the stairwell after Barne
Wait! I'm sorry, Barney! Let's start over! Please, Barney! Please!
Barney is aggressively chopping vegetables as he prepares food. Boogie crumples some hash to roll in a joint.
My uncle Irv offered to get me into TV production. He says there's all these tax loopholes in Canada that make it foolproof.
Pass the lighter off the table. Barney reaches for the lighter. He sees an ENVELOPE addre to him. He opens it and pulls out a HANDWRITTEN NOTE:
Dear Barney, Please come for dinner tonight at eight. I think it's important we talk. I'm sorry. I really do miss you. I need you. I'll even make latkes. Yours, Clara.
When did this come?
What? Oh, that. Shit. Sorry, I forgot. I think it came a few days ago. Barney looks at Boogie with disgust, throwing the lighter him on his way out the door.
Barney runs up the stairs.
Barney rushes in and finds a table set for a candlelight dinner for two. The candles completely burned away.
Clara? He slowly moves through the apartment...
A charred chicken and a tray of latkes out on the stove.  WHITE 10-23-09 25.

Where Clara lies dead on the bed. An empty bottle of slee pills at her side. Her sketches and poetry scattered all over the room. Barney drops to her, feels for a pulse. Nothing. His eyes well up with tears...

PANNING OVER soiled laundry, empty wine bottles, ashtrays the abstract painting of Leo's... to a hung over Barney, snoozing on the sofa, wakening to a POUNDING on the door. Rising unsteadily, Barney climbs over packed cartons labe "Clara's poetry, Clara's Sketches, Clara's Paintings". He opens the door. CHARNOFSKY (50), stands there. An Orthodox Jew, black hat black wool coat and a Van Dyke beard. His tie has been ne rent (cut) with scissors.
Are you here about the apartment?
I'm Chaim Charnofsky.
The Russian?

Brighton Beach. I'm Clara's father Your machuten. Are you going to invite me in? Still in a haze, Barney steps to the side. Hands clasped behind his back, Charnofsky wanders in, studying the apartment. He is immediately drawn to a specific INK SKET The completed sketch Clara started in the hospital: Barne drawn to look like Satan, along with a group of demons ravishing a pregnant young woman who looks much like Clar
Who would buy such a disgusting thing?
Actually, Clara made it. (beat) She said her parents were dead.  WHITE 10-23-09 26.
She's been saying that since she was ten. (looking Barney over) So you're the one she married? (off Barney's nod) I understand there was a child.
We lost him.
So you lost a son and I lost a daughter. May there be no more mourning in your house or mine. (beat) You have a bisel Schnapps?
Barney pours them each a Scotch.
I'm the Cantor of the B'Nai Jacob synagogue. It's not a princely living, but they provide us with an apartment. (looking at boxes) Clara's things?
Her notebooks. Poems, diaries, ink drawings. People think highly of her work. You should have a publisher look at them.

Diaries, you said? Filth about me and her mother, I'm sure. Ship them to my nephew. He's a professor of literature at NYU. He used to encourage her. Charnofsky finishes his drink. Pours himself another
I can imagine the guilt you're carrying right now, but you should know this wasn't the first time my Clara tried to kill herself. It all started when she was twelve. (MORE )

Tearing her hair out in clumps, "I'm not Jewish", "you're not my parents" she'd scream. She would refuse to eat, we'd have to force feed her chicken soup through a funnel, then she would vomit all over me on purpose. She'd run away for days and sneak black boys into the house so the whole neighborhood could see. My wife wanted to die. That's when I started locking her in the attic. She was a danger to everyone. My wife would bring her food, leave it outside the door. Once she goes to collect the dishes and lets out a shriek - you know why? Clara left a number two on the plate.
She was obviously sick.

You're telling me? We went to Dr. Kupner. The Head Rabbi's son-in- law, went to Harvard, the best in town. You think Clara was grateful? "He felt up my tits" she would scream in front of everyone at the hospital. It was a horror.
I think you should leave.
What? I've upset you?
Get out of here.
You dare speak to me that way? After all my wife and I endured for that child. We did everything we could, but only God determines the outcome.
God didn't lock a sick child in the attic. God didn't place his daughter in the hands of a molester then apologize for any embarrassment she may have caused him.  WHITE 10-23-09 28.
You act all high and mighty with me?! Barney takes hold of his arm and frog-marches him to the door and out into the hallway.
You couldn't have made her so happy either or she wouldn't have done that to herself.
Get out.
The man at the embassy told me she was dead two days before you found her. Two days! Where were you her loving husband?! An irate Barney takes a menacing step toward him.
Get out NOW. Charnofsky scrambles down the stairs, yelling back at Bar
Murderer, oysvorf, mamzer. I wish makkes on you and your unborn children!
Barney stirring a pot of boiling pasta. It's ready. Turns the burner off. Pulls out a STRAINER from a cupboard. He pauses for a moment, looking at the strainer quizzical He grabs the phone and dials.
Michael.
MICHAEL (26), Barney's son, in his Brooklyn loft. Sparsel decorated and immaculate except for his cluttered work ar filled with papers and stacks upon stacks of books.  WHITE 10-23-09 29.
Hi dad.
What do you call that thing you use for pasta...?
What?
I'm holding it in my goddamn hand - the thing to strain pasta...
A strainer?
The other word.
Colander.
COLANDER. See, this is what you have to look forward to. Barney prepares his pasta as he talks. Beat.
This is why you called?
And to say hello.
Hello.
I read online that O'Hearne's book finally came out.
Yeah, I heard about that.
How is it?

How would I know? I wouldn't read that garbage.  WHITE 10-23-09 30. Barney shuts O'Hearne's book, which we now see was open a dog-eared on the counter Just then, Michael's fiancee CAROLINE (28) comes home. A young lawyer in a power suit. She flips off her heels, gi him a kiss.
(whisper ) Who's that?
My dad. Caroline sneers.
Dad, I have to go, Caroline just got home. She says hi.
No she doesn't. How's the thesis coming along?
It's not, but I did find a title: "The colonialist racial ideologies of Western modernism in Bellow's work".
Catchy.
Thanks. I gotta go.

Sure. Michael hangs up. MOVE WITH BARNEY as he carries his bowl of pasta out to t BAR where he fixes himself a Scotch. After pouring his drink he pauses for a moment to stare a one of the many personal photos hanging behind the bar When he walks away WE REMAIN ON THE PHOTO he was looking In Black & White - Barney and his uncle IRV NUSSBAUM posi at a Fundraiser for Israel.

(into phone) --Abe, you know what happened last night? Some nazi punks took a shit right on the steps of the Beth Zion... that's right. That's why you can't get complacent with your support - we need Israel. I don't have to tell you where things like this lead to - it starts with a turd, next thing we're wearing arm bands again... (nodding)... wonderful, oh and you're coming for dinner this Friday, right? Great. Irv hangs up, pleased as punch.

Irv leads Barney through the factory.

I'm going to trust you with a few pledge cards to begin with. You do good for Israel, good will come your way. Now, the rules of the game: Never visit your target in the office where he's king shit and you're just another shmuck looking for a handout. You lure the lion out with meat --
Lunch time. Black tie waiters carry big juicy steaks, col slaw, and pickles to businessmen in booths.

Which are brought to Irv and Barney, now seated.

Barney having steak with ROBERT LANTOS. Barney looks a li green around the collar.

Is it a good show?
It's a mound of shit but it's the best goddamn tax shelter I've ever had.

my Aunt Sarah got me from Saks -- Did you know Reuben? He was such a card. That's why you're not a square like most of the Jewish boys I meet -- what are you smiling about? You're a little devil aren't you... Her grating qualities aside, she is sexy and the picture perfect Jewish wife. Maybe Irv's right.

Swanky.

Classical music. The gentle tinkling of silver cutlery on fine china. Dinner with the soon to be IN-LAWS - the WASPiest Jews yo ever seen. It's clear they are far from happy about this union. Everyone eats in horribly awkward silence.
Mr. Panofsky, I bet you have a lot of interesting stories, having been a detective and all.  WHITE 10-23-09 35.
Please, gorgeous, call me Izzy. And I was just a beat cop. Jews don't get promoted to detective in this town.
Have you encountered anti-semitism in your profession?

What do you think? Let me give you an example: One of my first shifts on the job, I corner four guys doing a dope deal in an alley. Big score for a rookie. I call for backup "cuz the rules say you can only put three in a patrol car, and I'm trying to play it by the book. You think they send anyone to help? The dispatcher says to me: "your people are good with numbers - you figure it out". So I toss three in the back, throw the fourth across the hood, handcuff him to the side-view mirror, then haul ‘em all in.
Oh my God, that's so dangerous.
Only when he blocked my view.
I meant for him.
You can't be soft with these degenerates.
Are you saying you were gratuitously violent with suspected felons?
Gratuitously? I always got paid, I ain't gonna work for free.
He means unnecessarily.
Look, when a feller is young and you give him authority, he likes to push (MORE )
people around. But I had to be extra careful because I knew my name was Panofsky. And most of the time I was.
Most? Did you ever consider that maybe your career advancement was stunted by your professional conduct and not by imagined prejudices?

I call it like I see it. I wore my name on my badge for everyone to see and all I ever did was walk the beat. But you're the one with the mansion on the hill, so what do I know? (to Second Mrs. P) You got brains from him and beauty from her - what a sweet little casserole you are. Let's make a toast. Izzy, Barney and The Second Mrs. P raises their glasses. The In-Laws don't even reach for theirs.

To the blessed match of our lovebirds. You never know what tomorrow brings. So get to shtupping and multiply already. Under the table Mrs. P squeezes Barney high up his leg. Barney flinches, then drinks along with Izzy and Mrs. P. The In-Laws set their glasses back down without sipping. Everyone continues eating.
This chicken is great. Cutlery tinkling...
It's fish.
Barney driving Boogie from the airport. Boogie looks like he hasn't slept for days.  WHITE 10-23-09 37.
I was starting to think you weren't going to show up. It's been two months since I last heard from you.
Has it really? Shit, have I got stories for you.
That, I have no doubt of.
Listen, man, are you sure you want to go through with this? We can turn around and be on a flight to Rome in a few hours - no questions asked. Lunch at Dal Bolognese on me.
C'mon, you haven't even met her yet. Anyway, I have two tickets in the reds to the Stanley Cup game tonight. Do you think after the dinner I can slip out to catch the third period?
I don't know. Brides tend to be a little touchy about things like that.
Fuck me.

300 guests. A huge affair. The band is ripping it up thro a raucous HORA that carries over the following moments: Barney and his mates do the Hora the way it should be don THE SECOND MRS. P SQUEALING and BARNEY feeling queasy as they are HOISTED up and down on chairs.
AN ARMY OF SERVERS burst forth from the kitchen carrying entrees. PLATES LAND at various tables.
The bride's side of the family all prim and proper -- The Second Mrs. P talking with her mother --  WHITE 10-23-09 38.
Darling, I just have to tell you again how gorgeous you look. And did you see how Marsha was looking at you?

Did I ever? Poison from her eyes she was so jealous. Do you remember her dress? She looked like a futon. IZZY making eyes at a curvaceous woman with a plunging neckline -- Father-In-Law watching Izzy with disdain but Maintaining a polite smile for appearances. His gaze is then drawn further down the table by -- BOOGIE, LEO AND CEDRIC toasting him.
Mazel Tov!!
The BAND playing an upbeat number for a jam-packed dancef Barney slips out from the crowd and races to the bar -- CU - A BLACK & WHITE TV hidden behind the bar showing the hockey game.
What's the score?
One - zip. Bruins just scored.
Shit. Barney downs another shot, then looks back to the dancefl where he sees IZZY slow dancing with The Second Mrs. P.

--I was denied the first time I tried to get on the force because I was too goddamn short, then I learned you had to clip a hundred dollar bill to your application. Suddenly, I was tall, dark and handsome enough.
Well, dark and handsome you most certainly are.  WHITE 10-23-09 39.
Oh boy, did my Barney ever luck out with you.
Oh, Izzy. It's me who's the lucky one.
Sunshine, from where I'm standing, trust me, he's the lucky one. Izzy grins and lays his head and her ample bosom.
Boogie emerges from behind the band, wiping his nose from having just done a hit of coke. He joins Barney, Izzy and friends at the bar watching the game.
Everyone ROARS at a near miss.
Go Habs! Come on! They all do a round of shots. Then more shots. And more shots. His FATHER IN LAW watching in disgust. The Second Mrs. P lunges onto him from out of nowhere--
Barney! Your father is sitting with the Rabbi! Go to do something quick! She SHOVES him toward the table.
The Rabbi and the other guests are visibly horrified by I anecdotes. Irv, knowing Izzy, loves every minute of it.

--so we're shaking down a rub and tug - I never bust the girls, they provide a valuable service - but we do it for appearances. Anyway, we're doing our thing and one of the clients - some crazy Hungarian Nazi loaded on Slivovitz starts going ape shit - he comes at me with a chair, butt naked with a hard-on like a can of hairspray--  WHITE 10-23-09 40.
Iz, maybe you should tone it down a little.
What, like they've never heard about such things?
Mr. Panosfky, there are ladies present.
C'mon Rabbi, everyone knows The Almighty tests the Jewish man with two great temptations: shiksas and bacon.
Dad, can I steal you away for a minute?
Don't anybody move. I'll be right back. As Barney escorts Izzy away, the ENTIRE TABLE, except for Irv, disperses.
Nice bunch of folks here tonight. I thought they'd all be snobby but I'm actually having a hell of a time. What are you laughing at?
Come here. Barney gives his father a big hug. At this moment he coul love him more. But then...
Dad, what's in your pocket?
I almost forgot. Izzy takes Barney to a quiet corner
Your wedding present. From inside his jacket, Izzy pulls out a GUN In Hanukkah wrapping paper.  WHITE 10-23-09 41.
My first gun. I want you to have it.
I don't know what to say.
Say thank you and get us a drink
Thank you. They walk to the bar. Slide out their glasses for refills
Your father-in-law said that neither of you was to have any more to drink Barney grabs a bottle himself and refills their glasses.
Where is that asshole?
Barney, don't embarrass me. Barney stomps off, pushing through the crowd. Gets his fa in law in his sights. Just as he is about to reach him, something catches his eye that stops him in his tracks.
ACROSS THE ROOM - MIRIAM GRANT (28), Gorgeous, classy, striking eyes. Barney is mesmerized.
Barney? Can I help you?
Uh, no, forget it... Barney turns away, but then cuts right back --
Don't ever tell my father what he can or cannot do again.
He traumatized the Rabbi's wife--
I don't care if he fingered her under the table. He's my father and he'll have your respect.  WHITE 10-23-09 42. Father-In-Law is speechless. And Barney sets out again for Miriam.
He emerges from a cluster of guests and spots Miriam. She chatting with a HANDSOME YOUNG MAN (JEFF) who excuses him and goes to the bar. Barney walks right up to her.
We haven't met yet. I'm Barney.
I'm Miriam. Thank you for having me. Barney is like a nervous and awkward teenager, not to men really drunk.
Are you alright?
Fine. Perfect.
I understand you're in television.
Totally Unnecessary Productions.
That's a little harsh.
That's the name of my company. She laughs. That's something he can never tire of. Miriam notices the UNLIT cigar he's holding.
Your cigar is out.
Oh, that's okay, I wouldn't want it to bother you.

Please, It's a Montecristo. She grabs a box of matches from the table. As she lights his cigar and talks it's as if the whole world around him has disappeared. The entire moment incredibly intimate.  WHITE 10-23-09 43.
Do you know why they're called Montecristo's?
Not a clue.

Fine cigars are all still rolled by hand. The workers who perform this task are called "torcedores", and they all chip in from their own wages to employ 'lectors' - people who read them stories as they work. Entertainment to make the day pass better. At the factory which produces this Montecristo, the workers favorite story was, you guessed it, the Count of said name.
Lectors.
Nice touch, don't you think? He's utterly smitten. Over her shoulder he spots the Bartender waving to get his attention the score now 1-1.
What is it?
Nothing. The hockey game.
Who's winning?
Habs just tied it up. You follow hockey?
No, but I do read newspapers.
Are you doing anything later? Wwe can still catch the flight to Rome. Lunch at Dal Bolognese on the Piazza del Popolo.  WHITE 10-23-09 44.
The bride may take issue with that. Anyway, I have to catch my train back to New York later She nods, and with perfect manners, rises and extends her
Congratulations again. He stands, takes her hand and would never let go if she d take it back. He stares at her walking away until--
Barney? The Second Mrs. P directly behind him.
Yes!
I see you met Miriam. She's sucha snob that one, don't you find?
Yeah - sure - no - why?
She went to McGill with me, works in radio now. The kind who subscribes to The Economist then buys Vogue off the stand. Now come explain to Judy and Leon that you don't make pornography.
Barney downs yet another Scotch. His tie loose around his neck, he's drunk and looks miserable. Boogie sits beside him, wiping his sniffling, coked-up nose.
Thanks for being here, Boogie.
I'll never miss any of your weddings. They knock glasses.
Oh, I almost forgot. Boogie rifles through his pockets then hands Barney a NOT  WHITE 10-23-09 45.
Classy dame. Smart as a whip too.
Who? Boogie points Barney across the room to MIRIAM. She has h coat on and is walking out with the Handsome Young Man.
Boogie, for the first time in my life I am truly, seriously, irretrievably in love. The Second Mrs. P appears behind him, draping her arms ar his neck.
Oh Barney, so am I. So am I.

Barney darts out of the Ritz Hotel and jumps into a taxi. It's raining. Cars are honking, people pouring out into t streets to celebrate their Hockey team's victory. Traffic is at a standstill so Barney hops back out and decides to by foot.

Barney, soaking wet, sprints down the stairs into the sta He sees the FLASHING LIGHT indicating the entrance to the NEW YORK CITY PLATFORM, where a porter is checking passen tickets. Thinking fast on his feet, Barney hurtles down t UPWARD rolling escalator to sneak onto the platform.

Barney makes his way through the train, passing from car car, looking for Miriam... whom he finally spots. She's wearing her reading glasses, engrossed in a novel. Barney takes a moment just to watch her. Just being able look at her makes him feel good. He drops into the seat next to her. She's stunned.
I like you with glasses. She takes them off. Shuts her book - Herzog by Saul Bello  WHITE 10-23-09 46.
What are you doing here?!
Run away with me.
What?
Run away with me, or stay with me, or I'll go with you--
Are you out of your mind?!
I'm heels over head, bent over backwards in love with you--
Leaving Montreal in two minutes!
How can you say you're in love with me? We just met - on your WEDDING NIGHT. Barney grins from ear to ear, overtaken by an unfamiliar sense of euphoria.
This isn't funny! Get off this train right now. Every word he says - every breath between every word - completely sincere and sober:
I can't believe this really happens. It really does, just like that. And I don't care if it happened on my wedding night, at a funeral, on my death bed. It's happened. Beat.
I.D., tickets. Miriam hands over her documents to the conductor
I don't have I.D. or a ticket.  WHITE 10-23-09 47.
Then you'll have to get off the train.
Go home, Barney. Among other things, sobriety and regret are anxiously waiting up for you. Barney finally concedes. He stands - the train LURCHES forward as it begins to pull out.
You look fantastic in that dress. Barney gets off the train.

Barney runs along with the train as it picks up speed. Mi sits at the window, but won't look at him. But then her eyes turn to Barney, watching him still chas after her, unconcerned with how utterly foolish he appear and she smiles at him. That smile is enough to melt his heart. He runs faster - into a flat-out sprint trying to get back on and then-- TRIPS and falls HARD onto the concrete platform.

On their honeymoon, Barney and The Second Mrs. P are walk through the shopping district adjacent to the Spanish Ste The Second Mrs. P trying to manage a huge fold-out map of Rome. Barney is morose and ill-tempered.

I'm embarrassing you?
Yes.
Like with the bidet?
You didn't have to ask the concierge. I could have told you what it was for.

No.
Am I embarrassed? She stares him down for a moment.
Snap out of it. We came to Rome to have fun not mourn the death of your first wife. She yanks him into a LINGERIE STORE. That perks him up slightly.

(into phone) --Ma, you should see the bathrobes we've got here, and the soaps are to (MORE )
die for... Of course I will, I've already stuffed three bars in my suitcase for you...
The Second Mrs. P cuts the labels off her designer clothe while on the phone to her mother. Barney lays on the bed reading the sports section of the International Herald Tr

(into phone) --It's from Dior. I wore it today and boy did I turn a lot of heads. I'm going to wear it to temple on the high holidays. Arlene will die on the spot... Barney only likes going shopping when I'm buying lingerie... What's wrong with that? Would you prefer he be like cousin Cyril?... Ma, they banned Cyril from the men's locker room at the Y.M.H.A... I'm just saying... Okay, sure, I'll talk to you tomorrow. Okay, tell Daddy I love him, I'll talk to you tomorrow. She hangs up and starts putting away the day's purchases.
I was just thinking about the wedding.
It was beautiful wasn't it?
Lots of relatives.
Well, we do have a big family.
You certainly do. (beat) Who was that guy from Chicago?
My cousin Isaac?
Right. (MORE)
And what about that girl, I think she was from New York, the one in the blue dress...
Miriam Grant.
Right. Who was she again?
She was a few years behind me at McGill. I didn't even invite her. My cousin Jeff brought her. She gets onto the bed beside him.
Jeff seems gay.
Jeff is gay. He just pretends for the family.
Oh good. Beat.
Good?
(covering) Better he should live a lie than inconvenience your family. (gets under bedspread) I'm going to take a quick nap before dinner.
Nap? I don't think so. The Second Mrs. P slides underneath the covers and starts going down -- but then POPS back up.
Did you wash it like I asked?
Yeah.
With soap?  WHITE 10-23-09 51.
Yes.
Okay. She dives back under and starts in again. It's like endur a highly invasive procedure.

Hurrying down the street, Barney passes a BOOKSTORE where new biography of CLARA CHAMBERS is prominently featured i the window display. The familiar ink drawing she made of Barney drawn as Satan, gracing its cover.
KATE is already waiting in line. Barney squeezes through the crowd, accidentally bumping the young woman standing behind them without apologizing. We'll call her ORGANI-GI
Sorry, I'm late. I took a cab.
That's okay, I just got here.
And how are you, my favorite offspring?
To tell you the truth - perplexed.
By what?
By you. (to cashier) Two double espressos. (to Barney) You do something awful, but instead of trying to make up for it, you opt for something infinitely worse.
What are you talking about?  WHITE 10-23-09 52.
Are you kidding?
I'm really not.
(leaning in) My father does the same thing.
Doesn't it make you crazy?
They just don't listen to anything--
(to Organi-Girl) Hey, flaxseed - this - is not going to happen. No crazies today. (to Kate) Continue.

Dad, before the recent phone incident you got Blair a subscription to "Boy Toy" monthly using his work address. Before that, you signed him up to an Al-Queda website. The man still can't fly out of the country.
I've upset Claire, haven't I?
You've upset Mom. Blair is too much of a chicken shit to say anything.
(kissing her cheek) You are truly my proudest achievement. They get their coffees and walk to the door.
My point is, it's time to lay off Blair.
He stole her from me.
No he didn't. You got divorced. She got remarried.  WHITE 10-23-09 53.
There was no one rooting for a comeback more than I was, but it's time to let it go. They're happily married. I'm sorry.
They're married. Stick to the facts.
An apology wouldn't hurt either.
Apologize to who? Kate gives up.
Why don't you come up to the cottage this weekend?
Actually, I have a date.
Nice boy?
No, he's a nasty piece of work.
Funny.
He's very nice. We'll see. It's our third date and I'm not bored silly or madly in love. I like him. I think that's a sign of maturity. Barney stops walking. Looks around. Confused.
What?
Where did I park my car?
You took a cab.
Right. (MORE)
(laughing it off) Well, I definitely need a weekend in the country.
Barney drives out of the city. The gorgeous Montreal skyl behind him.
Barney drives along a country road toward his cottage.

Barney is relaxing on the deck of his lakeside cottage. A Montecristo, Macallan's, reading "THE LIFE OF HEINRICH HE A RUSTLING comes from the woods. Barney looks up but it's pitch black out there. Probably a squirrel. Something RUSTLES again, this time a little closer. Barne stands, leans on the wood railing, trying to see through darkness. Waiting for something to appear. Hoping. From a distance, he hears the faint sound of a TWIN ENGIN AIRPLANE approaching. The sound carries over to --

A young Solange is acting in a scene staged in an obvious fake mock-up of an AIRPLANE COCKPIT SET. We now see why s was originally hired; she's a total knockout. Wearing a tight, low cut outfit, she's tending to O'MALLE who has a small cut on his forehead.
Thank you, nurse.
Thank you for landing us safely, Constable.
Hopefully the weather will be more forgiving next time I pass through.
Well you can be sure my landing strip will be cleared for you.  WHITE 10-23-09 55.
CUT! Great, turning around! Solange immediately bursts into tears. The crew go about their business.
(to Barney) What's wrong with Solange?
Her fiancee died in a plane crash.
That was over a year ago. Look at her, you'd think it just--
To let you finish that thought would be an insult to stupidity.
Barney, there's a call for you. A Miriam Grant-- Barney BOLTS from his chair.
(into phone) Miriam?!
Miriam closes the door to a tiny office for privacy.
Barney, this has to stop.
You got my flowers?
I got the flowers, and the gifts - every week it's something else. I don't know where to start with how inappropriate all this is.
Just skip ahead to where I've already gone from annoying and inappropriate to charming and endearing.  WHITE 10-23-09 56.
You're a married man and I won't be involved with you in any way.
I know, I'm sorry. Why don't we talk about it over lunch. I could be there tomorrow--
Are you listening to me?
Every word.
Really? Well, words matter. Actions matter. They have consequences. If you want people to take you seriously, then act accordingly. Do you understand me, Barney?
Yes.
What am I saying?
(beat) "Be great in act, as you have in thought".
(surprised) Well, yes, exactly. (curt) I have to go. Stop this nonsense and focus on your marriage.
I'm so happy you called. Thank you. Barney smiles, feeling like progress is being made.

(into phone) --I had a bowl of cottage cheese and fruit, I'm watching my figure... Ma, so don't eat bagels if they make you bloated... (re: Clara's Drawing) Get rid of this filth... No, ma, I wasn't talking to you... To the king of Macedonia, who do you think?... I know it's disgusting... Ma, you asked!... Okay, I'll pick you up at noon. Goodbye. She hangs up. Looks at Clara's drawing again.
If you don't throw this out, I will.
I'll bring it up to the country house.
And make sure your buddy doesn't throw up all over the place. We just changed all the carpets. Barney continues reading - tuning her out completely.  WHITE 10-23-09 58.
Barney!
Absolutely.
Tell me something - you were at the game last night, do you think the score somehow changed overnight?
(standing) I have to get going.
What's important?
THIS. Talking. Communicating. This is what marriage is.
(annoyed) You don't want Boogie puking all over the carpets and your mother's bloated. Does that pretty much cover it?
Do I talk down to you like that?
I really have to go. See you ina couple days. A quick peck on the forehead and he's gone.

Barney waits in his car outside a fleabag hotel. Boogie emerges from the building, high, stumbles toward Barney's car. He looks like the full-fledged junkie he has become. His appearance is shocking to Barney.
Guess I don't qualify for the "you look great" greeting.
Just get in. Boogie gets in the car. In bad shape.  WHITE 10-23-09 59.
I thought you came here to kick.
C'mon, I was on a fifteen hour flight I had to fix one more time. (beat) I'm really going to kick this time. A week locked up in the country and I'll be good as new.

Barney pulls up to the cottage with Boogie passed out in front seat. THE SECOND MRS. P is on the porch, drinking wine, looking very attractive in a tight fitting summer d Barney helps Boogie up the steps.

Surprise.
Barney drops Boogie onto the bed. He's out cold.

Why didn't you tell me this was why you were coming up here?
He asked me not to tell anyone, and he needed somewhere safe to kick.

Wow, are we ever in for a good time this weekend.

Well played, no hesitation.
You're going to be very embarrassed when those show up.

Stop. I called the florist. While usually discreet about their clients, the ray of sunshine that is you left the manager eager to tell me you have a standing order of roses to someone in New York every week.
Jesus Christ. This is ridiculous. You want to pick through every receipt I have? I'm not going to stay here and take this. Barney storms out to the DECK.
She follows him out.
Be a man, Barney. Barney stares out at the lake. He won't look her in the e
I've never been unfaithful to you.
So who are the flowers for?
An actress we're trying to get for a new pilot.  WHITE 10-23-09 61.
What's her name?
Can we talk about this in the morning?

No. I don't understand what you want anymore. Before we got married you couldn't keep your hands off me. Now it's been months since we made love. You say you've never been unfaithful, so what is it then? (softer) On our wedding night I came up behind you and you were saying how hopelessly in love you were. It was the happiest moment of my life. I keep going back to that just to have something to hold onto. (beat) What happened? Why did you even marry me? He can't bring himself to answer her. It hurts her like hell, but she's not going to cry in front of him.
I'm so ashamed. And you are such a liar. Fuck you. She goes back inside.
The sound of cicada. The calm of the lake. Barney's cotta is a true country paradise.
Wiping the sleep from her eyes, The Second Mrs. P shuffle into the kitchen and finds a note on the fridge: "Had to go into town for the day. Call you later - Barney
Shmuck.
Barney parks in front of Grumpy's and heads inside.
Two Scotches on the table. Izzy reads the paper as he wai for Barney in a booth. Barney drops down across from him.  WHITE 10-23-09 62. Beat.
I have to get a divorce.
Jesus Christ. (beat) Did you cheat?
No.
Did she?
No.
So what happened?
I'm in love with someone else.
Who?
You don't know her.
Where'd you meet her?
You don't want to know.
You ask me here to talk and now you don't want to talk. What do you want from me?
Some paternal wisdom.

Boychick, listen. I know how hard marriage can be. In the beginning it's all briskets and blowjobs and la-di-da, ain't life grand, and then real life starts. You come home from work and all they want to do is talk and all you want to do is screw and soon enough every (MORE )
Beat.
day is like pushing an avocado through a cheese grater - it all just feels like you're holding shit in your hands.

Maybe you just need to take a step back before you do anything rash. Let's take a good, hard look at the situation. You're married to a well- bred woman who's loaded, makes a nice, flaky kugel and has a great rack. Many successful marriages were built on far less.
Can we drop this? Just forget I ever said anything.
She's a tough cookie. If you divorce her, she's gonna take you to the cleaners.
You know how rich her father is. She's going to inherit a shitload of money.
And you think that'll stop her from taking all of yours?
I don't care.
Is that so?
Yeah. Izzy registers the depth of Barney's true feelings.
So tell me her name.
Miriam.  WHITE 10-23-09 64.
And is this the one? Is she the mother of your children?
Absolutely.
Alright then, let's do this.
Barney lays on the sofa watching TV. Scotch. Cigar
(into phone) I'll be back tomorrow. I'm too drunk to drive tonight.
You're leaving me with the junkie?! Are you with your whore?
No.
So you do have a whore! You sonofabitch, my father was right about you-- Barney holds the phone away from his ear as she drones on He considers responding, but then just hangs up.
Still hungover, chugging coffee, Barney drives up to the cottage. The RADIO NEWS tells us it's 8:25 AM.
Barney enters the house. Walks down the hall. Hears noise coming from the guest bedroom. He opens the door to find.
The Second Mrs. P, naked, moaning, and riding Boogie in t midst of hot, hard sex until she sees Barney:

The Second Mrs. P rolls off Boogie and falls onto the flo with a cringe worthy THUD.  WHITE 10-23-09 65. Kicking and screaming, she scrambles to cover herself wit the bedding, spilling an open bottle of Whisky in the pro Barney is frozen with shock
Barney backs out of the room...
It takes a moment for the situation to sink in. Once it does, he smiles. Things are looking up for him.
In only her nightie, The Second Mrs. P storms out of the guest room past Barney.
This is all your fault, you bastard, sonofabitch- -
My fault?! Barney follows her into --
In tears, she throws on whatever clothes she can find.
My wife and my best friend...
I brought him something to eat, he was trembling, his sheets were soaked, I only laid down beside him to try to keep him warm... I still don't know how he got my nightie off.
It must have been magic, then.
We shouldn't talk about this now while I'm so upset.
You're so upset?! She hustles out and down the hall. He follows.  WHITE 10-23-09 66.
I'm going to my mother's.
Tell her we're getting divorced! She exits.
She goes toward her car. Barney right behind her
You tell her yourself! No, don't - she has a root canal today. She gets in her car, starts the engine, rolls down the wi
I was coming back to try to work things out.
Bullshit. I bet the two of you perverts arranged this together
Ha! I'm going to kill him for this then I'll come for you, and just for kicks, your mother after that!
Go to hell! Animal! She drives away, kicking up a cloud of dust in her wake.
Barney walks in to find Boogie chugging right from a bott of Scotch. He's already very drunk.
I should kill you for this.
What you should have done was call first. Boogie pours Barney a glass, who reticently takes it.
How could you do that to me?  WHITE 10-23-09 67.

She did it to me. It was innocent enough to start with - she brought me something to eat, started talking - you know how that goes - tells me how you've been shirking your husbandly duties, que sera sera...
So you fucked her?
It was the only thing that would shut her up. Boogie shakes the empty Scotch bottle at Barney.
Check the dining room. I'm going to need you to do something for me. Testify that I came home to you in bed with my wife.
You sly bastard - you planned this all along.
Who could plan this?
I don't see any Scotch, but look here... Boogie comes back up with an open WOOD BOX containing the GUN from Izzy. He takes it out, waves it around.
What do you say? Duel at high noon? But I don't think we have enough booze to get us there. Barney grabs the gun away from Boogie.
That's loaded, shmuck. There's more Scotch in the kitchen.

Ice is dropped into two tumblers. More Scotch poured. They've gone through half the bottle and are visibly drun Boogie peruses Barney's book collection. He picks up Clar sketch that's leaning against the wall.  WHITE 10-23-09 68.

Did you hear they named a new auditorium at Barnard after her? Crazy Clara Chambers - she wasn't too bad a poet, actually. I bet this is worth a pretty penny now. Hey, who gets the residuals from her books?
I signed the rights over to charity right after she died. Listen, will you testify or not?
I'll think about it.
You know what? It's time you came through for me for once.
Really?
How many times have I bailed you out over the years?
I wasn't counting.
Neither was I.
You sure about that?
When I had nothing, I borrowed for you. You owe me.

Well isn't this getting interesting. But I'd like to go for a swim and think it over. You must have a snorkel and flippers here. Boogie grabs the bottle of Scotch and heads to the sunroo Barney follows him out, the gun still in his sweater pock
Boogie rifles through a trunk and finally comes up with a SNORKEL, MASK AND FLIPPERS.  WHITE 10-23-09 69.
How's your novel coming along?
Are you asking as a friend or an investor?
Both.
I'm still working on it.
You're a fraud.
Oh, have I let poor Barney down?
Yeah, you have.
Too fucking bad. You know what, man? I brought you in. I educated you. I put the right books in your hands, and look what you've become. A TV hustler, married to a rich man's vulgar daughter.
Not so vulgar that you wouldn't bang her.
And she wasn't the only wife of yours I had. Next time I'm in New York I'll call on your tart and make it a trifecta. Boogie pushes through the screen door
Boogie staggers toward the dock, drunk and barely able to walk a straight line.
Barney CHARGES Boogie. They start to wrestle but are too drunk to really take it anywhere serious. They break apar winded and woozy.
What happened to you?  WHITE 10-23-09 70.
Nothing. Absolutely nothing happened to me; and that's what you take as a personal offense. I am not your pet project. Not your vicarious life. Not your hope.
Not my friend? Boogie doesn't even think to answer. He just swigs from t bottle again.
Do you realize you haven't come close to giving me an apology?

Let me recommend another book to stock your shelf with; "The Life of Heinrich Heine", who upon his death bed was begged by his loved ones to ask for God's forgiveness before he passed. But good old Heinrich had only this to say: "God will surely forgive me - after all, that's his fucking job".
Don't count on it.
I'm going for a swim. Boogie slips on the flippers, waddles onto the dock
Boogie, stop! You're too drunk and you can barely swim anyway. I'll shoot, you prick, I will! Barney fires a WARNING SHOT straight up into the air.

There you go! But this time shoot it at me you fucking coward! See for yourself what's really inside this mossy, dampened cavity you think is a heart. C'mon, do it! Barney stares him down. A silent rage boiling inside. Boo grins, snaps on the goggles and the snorkel, spreads his arms wide, tilts his head back...  WHITE 10-23-09 71.

Don't you fucking move. Barney drunkenly staggers forward, pointing the gun at Bo AND THIS ALL HAPPENS IN HAZY FLASH: Barney TRIPS -- the g FIRES -- Boogie lets himself FALL backward into the lake. It appears the gun fired into the air, but he could have fired in Boogie's direction. We can't be sure. Barney turns and heads back up into the house. We DO NOT see Boogie resurface.
Barney stumbles in. Barney hits the bottle hard - one shot after another.
The bottle now empty. Barney's passed out on the sofa.
Barney on the floor, woken by the the RUMBLING of a TWIN AIRPLANE, starting from a distance and approaching fast.
He stumbles out to the porch, still half drunk. The PLANE flying over a distant hillside.
(calling out)
UNIFORMED POLICEMEN and SEARCH DOGS scour the property ar Barney's house. DIVERS break the surface of the lake's wa A POLICE BOAT out there too. Barney watches all this from the dock.
Busy day. There's a big fire a few miles east.  WHITE 10-23-09 72. DETECTIVE SEAN O'HEARNE, younger, slimmer, healthier than know him to be, steps up along side Barney.
Twenty cottages burned so far
They're wasting their time out there. I told them I looked all over the lake in my boat. He's broken into a cottage, emptied it of all the booze and pills he could find and moved on.
But he leaves his clothes and wallet here?
He took someone else's clothes.
No break-ins have been reported. Got something to drink?
Barney opens the refrigerator and passes O'Hearne a cold O'Hearne saunters through the house, sipping the beer He stops at the FRAMED SKETCH BY CLARA leaning against th
That's kind of sick.
My first wife made that.
(taking out notepad) Oh yeah? What's her name?
She's dead.
Did you catch her fucking someone too?
She killed herself.
Beat you to it, I guess.  WHITE 10-23-09 73.
What the fuck does that mean? I called you guys.
Yeah, you did. So why didn't you mention this gun? O'Hearne pulls out Barney's GUN, in a plastic evidence ba
My dad is a retired cop. He gave it to me for protection.
(dawning) Are you fuckin' Izzy Panofsky's kid?
Yes.
No shit. So why are there two rounds missing?
Boogie and I were horsing around.
By shooting off rounds?
We were drunk.
This was after you caught him fucking your wife?
It wasn't like that.
You shot off the rounds before you walked in on them screwing?
No.
After.
Yes.  WHITE 10-23-09 74.
So you did shoot him.
Yeah, right through his fucking heart, Jesus Christ--
(take notes) Now we're getting somewhere.
Are you a complete idiot? Why are you wasting your time here? Go find him! Have you thought that he might be hurt somewhere?
And what about this piece of ass you're keeping in New York - the florist gave us her name - Miriam Grant... Barney grabs O'Hearne --
You keep her out of this-- O'Hearne drives a knee into his groin, then lays one into Barney's face, sending him to the floor

Two bullets shot from your gun just after you caught your best friend banging your wife. You threatened to kill them both, and now he's missing. Unless you ate him, we'll find the body before sundown. So tell me where the body is and I'll say you were cooperative and remorseful, you'll get yourself a smart Jew lawyer and be out in no time. No one cares about a useless junkie anyway. Barney lifts himself to one knee.
Go to hell. O'Hearne kicks him in the gut once, then again, when... IZZY grabs O'Hearne from behind and throws him off Barney
What are you doin' here, Panofsky?  WHITE 10-23-09 75.
I got a call from my son.
Very sweet, but he attacked an officer of the law.
From where I'm standing this looks like police brutality.
Like you're one to talk.
You leave your hands off him.
He's goin' down for murder.

Really? It seems those razor-sharp detective skills of yours missed one tiny detail; you don't have a body. Now you got anything else to say, talk to his lawyer. O'Hearne exits. Izzy kneels to look at Barney's face.
So, did you do it?
Dad! Of course not.
Alright, alright. Let me get you some ice.
O'Hearne is on TV responding to a crowd of reporters out the Townships.
--For the moment no charges are being laid. We've searched the area for three weeks. (MORE )

No body has been found yet, so this will remain a missing persons case even with the overwhelming circumstantial evidence implicating Mr. Panofsky. Our hands are tied. PULL OUT from the TV and follow the RECEPTIONIST, carryin YELLOW ENVELOPE onto the soundstage. Barney is half-aslee as the crew sets up for the next shot.

Barney, the papers you were waiting for just arrived-- Barney bolts upright, grabs the envelope, tears it open a pulls out his divorce papers. He rushes to the nearest ph dials, and signs the marked pages.

Hello?

Please, Miriam.  WHITE 10-23-09 77. Beat.

Flying over Manhattan. A sunny morning in the big apple.

Two pair of shoes, three suits, four ties laid on the bed The clock reads: 10:03 AM. (into phone) I'd like a bottle of Dom Perignon well chilled, and a dozen long stem roses brought to my room at exactly two o'clock.... make that two bottles and two dozen roses.... great. You hardly know me. The waiter arrives with the Champagne.
Wonderful, now we can celebrate.
Celebrate what? The room begins to tilt and sway. Barney's panicking, desperately trying to hold it together.  WHITE 10-23-09 80.
(slurring words) Now that I'm no longer a married man we can... we're finally here together... you, me...
Barney, are you alright?
Excuse me. He BOLTS toward the MEN'S ROOM.
Barney is throwing up into the toilet of his suite. Miria pulls the bathroom door shut. Then, there's a KNOCKING at the front door.
Room service.
Miriam is sitting in an easy chair, her legs crossed, rea the New York Times. Barney stirs awake. She moves to sit at the edge of the bed.
How are you feeling?
You're never going to speak to me again I'm going to kill myself. Beat.
Are you done?
Please don't leave. She reaches for his page of HANDWRITTEN CRIB NOTES titled "conversation topics".  WHITE 10-23-09 81.
What would you like to talk about - All The President's Men, Herzog or Alphonse Daudet - nice reference, by the way.
I'm an idiot.
Don't be so modest. You obviously expected me to come up to your room.
Never.
So the champagne and roses are for another woman? Barney lifts his throbbing head to see for himself. Sure enough there's two bottles of champagne and two dozen ros
Oh God... He covers his face and begins to MOAN. Miriam finds it al utterly amusing. She pries his hands from his face.
Why don't you get cleaned up, we'll get some fresh air, and maybe a slice of pizza. I'm absolutely starving. Off Barney's delight --
They stroll along the park. Barney rambles on, desperatel trying to keep Miriam engaged. He hardly even breathes between words.

--"The Big Apple" is actually an old racetrack term, credited to John Fitzgerald - a sports writer for the herald in the 30's. He'd heard old stable hands from Mississippi use it when referring to the New York racetracks. Getting to race in New York was considered hitting the big time - getting a bite of that "Big Apple" and I'm just going to keep talking because I'm afraid if I stop (MORE )

there's going to be pause, or a break where you'll say "it's getting late" or, "I should probably get going" and I'm not ready for that to happen, I don't want it to happen. Ever. And then he finally just runs out of steam. They stop wal and face each other for what seems like an eternity to hi
There it was. The pause.
Yeah. Beat.
I'm still here.
They walk along the East River. Their body language now more intimate.
--I adored my father. He was my hero. Until I found out he was sleeping with every factory girl he could get on the side. (beat) It killed my mother. That's what gave her cancer.
That's a bit unfair.
No, it's not. It devastated every part of her. Mind and body. Heart and soul. And that will never happen to me.
I would never do that to you.
I want one thing from you.
Anything.  WHITE 10-23-09 83.

See, that's what scares me about you. Don't answer ‘anything’. That's not real, and life is real. It's made up of little things - minutes and hours and errands and naps and routine, and that has to be enough. After all you've done to pursue me, how can I ever trust you?
That's a reasonable question. Barney thinks hard. He knows he needs to come up with something good. Then he rifles through his pocket and pul out a CIGAR CLIPPER. He SNAPS it shut for effect.
I'll cut it off. Right away.
Now you're offering to be my eunuch?
Like I said, I'll do anything for you, Miriam.
Well, you're not going to do that. We're going to be needing it. She kisses him. Together they fall into an embrace neithe will ever forget.
Barney and Miriam have an outdoor wedding ceremony at his cottage. Only closest friends and family are in attendanc including Solange and Jeff (from the wedding) and his boy
--And do you take this man to be your lawfully wedded husband?
I do.
And do you--
I sure as hell do.  WHITE 10-23-09 84. Barney can't wait another second. He kisses her
Izzy, tears already streaming down his face, grabs Miriam and gives her a hard kiss on the lips. Everyone CHEERS!

The party is winding down. Guests are still up at the hou on the porch, drinking, slow dancing. It's a beautiful ni Barney is out on the dock alone, staring at the lake when joins him. She wraps her arms around him from behind.
He promised he'd never miss any of my weddings. Miriam kisses him tenderly then takes him by the hand and leads him back up to the house.

Put the onion in the freezer for a few minutes before you chop it. Then it won't make you cry.

They watch Michael fast asleep in his crib. Then look at each other with mischievous grins --

Barney appears in the doorway in his boxers. Miriam is already naked and waiting with her best "come hither" loo He runs and leaps onto the bed. They laugh hysterically a they roll around and start to make love.

Tell your mother we threw them all back. Barney lays down their rods and pulls on the RIPCORD. The engine won't turn. He tries again, and again, working up big sweat. He takes a breather. Michael stares blankly at him.

I'm a vegan, but thank you.
