I don't want to impose, and I should paddle back before it gets dark. It was lovely to meet the both of you. They all say goodbye and Blair exits.
(calling out) Michael, want to do the bar-b-que?
Yeah.  WHITE 10-23-09 88.
Fire it up.

The bar-b-que is lit. Miriam carries hamburger patties ou to the boys when they all hear -- RRRRR - the sound of an outboard motor. They all look dow to the lake where they see Blair standing on the dock.
(yelling) It was just a loose distributor wire. And I re-attached the rip cord. Blair waves, then hops in his canoe.
That was nice of him. Barney grunts and waves half heartedly.
Miriam's RADIO SHOW plays on the radio.

--and we're going to end our program with a request from our regular listener, Alphonse from Montreal: Leonard Cohen's "Dance Me To The End Of Love". I'm Miriam Grant. As always, thank you for listening.
As he chops an ONION while cooking dinner. The phone RING He answers, pressing his sleeve to his eyes to halt the s
Hello?... Michael, hi... I land at five... I'll just grab a cab to your place... okay, love you. He hangs up. The song continues over --  WHITE 10-23-09 89.
Barney riding in a yellow cab with a bag from SCHWARTZ'S the seat beside him. He sees a young couple kissing in th same spot where he and Miriam first kissed.

Barney and Michael watch a hockey game together. Barney i yelling at the TV, halfway through a bottle of Scotch and smoking a cigar. The table littered with remnants of a me from Schwartz's Smoked Meat.

(yelling at TV) Useless goddamn pansy ref, get your head out of your ass!! Caroline enters - business suit, briefcase. A belligerent Barney coupled the disorderly mess of the apartment is th last thing she wanted to end her day with. Michael greets her at the door.
I thought you were going out for dinner.
(apologetic) ) Dad brought in smoked meat from Montreal.
(to Michael) Didn't we agree to no cigars in the house? Barney looks to Michael for backup, but is met with silen He grudgingly taps out the cigar.
Am I still allowed to use the bathroom or would you prefer I leave my business in paper bags by the door? Recyclable ones, of course.
Turn that down please, I have to get up early. She heads off to the bedroom. Michael scowls at Barney.  WHITE 10-23-09 90.
What? The woman hates me.
Maybe she wouldn't hate you if you didn't behave like a child.
Chicken and the egg.
No, dad, it's not. You can't keep acting this way. Not with us, or Mom and Blair.
So you're speaking for your mother now?
Just leave them alone already. She's not coming back to you.
If that's what you're so angry about, then fine. Tell your mother from this moment on she is forgotten. Erased. Nothing but a wisp of gray on the otherwise full, dark mane of my life.
I'm sure she'll appreciate the sentiment if not the poetry. Good-night. Michael starts to walk out--
Michael...
What?
What have you told her about me?
I tell her everything. That's what couples do.
Spare me the sermon. I see the way she looks at me.
What are you talking about?  WHITE 10-23-09 91.

I saw O'Hearne's book on her night table. She can't even be bothered to hide it from me. How could you let her read that? She even has all these pages dog-eared in it... (beat) When she asks about Boogie, what do you tell her? Michael doesn't answer Barney readies himself for one of the hardest things he's ever had to ask.
Do you think I could have possibly done that? Beat.
Only you really know. Michael exits. That devastates Barney. He simply deflates From outside, a CAR ALARM has begun to whine. Its incessa squeal turns into --
Barney pours two cups of tea. Then smells a jar of HONEY, not sure if it's still good.
Barney carries the tea and honey on a tray. Miriam is on the sofa watching a NEWS MAGAZINE PROGRAM.
(re: on TV) That's Taylor Gates.
(re: honey) Tell me if this is still good.  WHITE 10-23-09 92.
She was my intern before we got married. She could barely string two words together. Miriam drips the honey into her tea without smelling it. passes it to Barney who is still not convinced it's edibl
Honey doesn't go bad.
Ever?
Archeologists found honey in Egyptian tombs thousands of years old and it was still edible. Barney shrugs, uses the honey. Miriam curls herself into the corner of the sofa, feeling depressed.
Everyone seems to be doing pretty interesting things nowadays.
Giving birth and raising two amazing children is pretty interesting.
But it doesn't command much respect now does it?
Miriam- -
It doesn't matter. Miriam grabs a magazine from the coffee table, shutting d the conversation.
Autumn. Michael (now 18) and a few buddies have loaded th last of his things into a small U-Haul. It's off to colle
(crying) My baby.
Mom, I'm not going to war. I'll be back for thanksgiving.  WHITE 10-23-09 93. She kisses Michael one last time.
Okay, I'm going inside.
(to Barney) Any last words of wisdom?
You need money, ask me. Don't start selling dope.
No selling dope. Got it. Anything else? Barney takes him in his arms.
I love you.
I love you too, dad. A quick goodbye to Kate (16).
Take care of yourself. Michael jumps into the truck, starts to pull out.
Pull over if you get tired!
Barney and Miriam having lunch out in the lush, beautiful garden of the Ritz. Miriam stares absently at her plate. Her mind elsewhere. She sets down her cutlery. Her food only half eaten.
He had to move out eventually.

I know. That's not it. (beat) I want to go back to work. I've been thinking about this for a while. Blair said he can get me freelance work. It's just research and writing for now but it could lead to other things. Maybe even on air.  WHITE 10-23-09 94.
And I'm sure Blair will do everything he can for you.
Stop that.
(beat) Are you unhappy?
No. Not in the way you're trying to get at.
Then in which way? JEAN THE MAITRE'D comes over.
How is everything?
Excellent, as always.
May I get you anything else?
We're fine. Thank you, Jean. Jean leaves. Barney sulks, polishing off his wine.
I knew how you would take this.
It's just that I've worked this hard so you wouldn't ever have to. So you could be here with the kids and me. We both agreed that was important.

It was important. But Michael's gone, soon Kate will be too, and you're as grown up as you'll ever be. Where does that leave me? I need more stimulation in my life. I have to believe I can be something other than just a wife and mother.
I'll quit working. (MORE )
We'll retire early, travel, go to Italy, get a Villa on Lake Como.
You can't just fix this like you do everything else. I don't want you to. (beat) I need to do this. Can you try and understand?
Of course. Whatever you want to do, I'm behind it. A hundred percent. He fakes through the deep panic he's feeling inside.
Miriam interviews a distinguished looking man on the air
...Well, Mr. Dalhousie, that's all the time we have. Thank you so much for coming in.
It is was a pleasure. Thank you. The ON AIR light turns OFF. Miriam lets out a big sigh of relief. The staff on the other side of the glass APPLAUD.
Miriam walks down the Hall with BLAIR.
I hope that wasn't too painful.
Are you kidding? It was fantastic.
Stop it, Blair.
Really, Miriam, you're a natural.
Thank you. Would you excuse me, I'm going to call Barney.
Of course.  WHITE 10-23-09 96.
The phone RINGS through an empty house.
Barney is sitting at the bar, watching the hockey game. T bar ERUPTS at a bad penalty call.
What the hell kind of call is that INSERT - BARNEY'S CELL PHONE - on the bar, ringing. He doesn't hear it.
Miriam hangs up. Upset that Barney didn't answer
Barney tiptoes into the dark, quiet apartment. He's drunk and trying very hard to be quiet.
Miriam is already asleep. Barney is about to crawl into b
Where have you been? Miriam turns on the bedside lamp.
I was at Grumpy's watching the game.
Did you hear my interview?
I'm sorry, I just lost track of--
This was important to me. You knew that right?
(beat) Yes.
But you missed my first on air interview because you were drunk and watching a hockey game, like you've done a thousand times before.  WHITE 10-23-09 97.
(beat) Yes.
Okay. I wanted to be sure we're clear on what happened here tonight. Miriam flips back over and turns the lamp OFF.
Should I sleep on the sofa? She turns the lamp back ON.
Stop feeling sorry for yourself. You're not sleeping on the sofa, we don't sleep apart. Good night. She turns the light OFF.
Barney has accompanied IZZY to his Mother's grave.
You got yourself a plot yet?
No.
You should get one. The good ones go fast. Izzy places a rock on the double headstone: ESTHER PANOFSKY - 1925 - 1972, Wife to Izzy, Mother to Ba Engraved beside hers is Izzy's name: ISRAEL PANOFSKY
You okay?
Sure. But he's not very convincing.
I was thinking, why don't you move in with us? Now that the kids are gone we have more than enough space.  WHITE 10-23-09 98.
Thanks, but no thanks.
I don't like the thought of you being alone.
I'm not alone. See that? That's alone. Izzy points to a single grave beside theirs.
Buried alone. No wife. No kids. That's alone. I'm going to be right here with your mother. When you get to my age you'll see what a comfort that is.
I know it must be hard without her
I'm used to being without her. I need to get laid.
(walking away) Jesus Christ...
What? How long have you ever had to hold out, Mr. THREE wives!
A group of Miriam's friends including BLAIR, are over for dinner. Blair holds court while Barney broods over his Sc bored and annoyed with Blair's politically correct discou

--I think it's fair to say that in 50 years we'll look back on this time and our inhumane treatment of animals for the sake of mass consumption, as a shameful and barbaric chapter in our history, much like how we perceive segregation or McCarthyism- - Barney can't stand another second of this. He gets up and brings a cigar back to the table.
Barney, please don't smoke that. You know it irritates Blair's asthma.  WHITE 10-23-09 99. Without a moment's pause, Barney heads out to the den.
Barney lights his cigar with great pleasure. The dinner guests continue with their conversation.
Barney crawls into bed with a moan. Miriam's reading. Bar stares at the ceiling, exhausted. Long silence. Miriam sets down her book.
If you can't at least be civil with my friends then don't bother joining us.
I thought I was perfectly civil.
You fell asleep at the table. Beat.
I forgot to ask, how was the cemetery?
Good times. The phone RINGS. Barney groans. Reaches for the phone.
A non-descript building with a red neon sign: MASSAGE. Ba parks right in front, then enters.
PUSH IN through a beaded curtain and into the waiting roo of an old school "rub and tug" massage parlor. The Madame, GOLDIE (45) is consoling a working girl, who sobbing. Goldie looks up at CAMERA --
Barney...? Barney nods. She takes his hand. Barney's eyes searching. He's at a loss. She takes him by the arm and leads him do the hall.  WHITE 10-23-09 100.
After they finished, the girl left the room to get a hot towel. When she went back in... At least he went happy. She stops in front of room #4.
He talked about you all the time. You made him so proud. She opens a door and lets Barney go in --

Barney enters, takes in the room. Goldie shuts the door leaving him alone. The lighting dim. The walls bare. A sh with a bottle of baby oil, a box of kleenex. Izzy's body lays on the table, covered in a white sheet. peaceful, half-grin on his face. Barney sits on a small chair beside the body. He lifts th edge of the sheet and takes his father's hand in his. He starts to laugh at the situation, patting his father's ha Then he squeezes it tighter, holding it with both his han pressing it to his forehead, and starts to cry.
Barney exits the room. He sits beside Goldie in the reception. They share a quiet moment.
He didn't get a chance to settle up.
Beat. Barney reaches into his pocket, hands her a couple hundred from his wallet.
Barney grabs an ice cube from the freezer for his Scotch. Before shutting the door he pulls out an ONION - stares a it quizzically - then puts it back.
You sure you don't want anything?
No, thanks.  WHITE 10-23-09 101. Barney goes into the DEN and refills his Scotch before si down to continue his Scrabble game with Kate.
It's your turn.
What did you do?
Right there. Barney stares at the board. Confused.
Sorry. He sets down his pieces.
What word is that? INSERT - SCRABBLE BOARD. His pieces spell: "ATTNY"
Attorney.
You're missing half the letters.
It's the abbreviation.
When you get that lazy with cheating, I know you're tired. She gets up and starts to clean up.
Leave that, I'll do it.
No, dad. Let me. Barney can tell that she needs to keep herself busy. He takes her arm to stop her and pull her down to sit.
Do you want to talk about it?  WHITE 10-23-09 102.
I'll be fine. I'm just happy it only took eight months to realize he was a jerk. He pulls her into a comforting embrace. That's all it tak for her to start crying in his arms.
It'll be okay. I promise. She cries as long as she needs to. They break apart, she wipes her eyes on her sleeve.
Let me get you a tissue.

No, I'll get it. She gets up to go to the washroom. Barney watches her go. His eyes drift over and stop on LEO'S PAINTING prominentl displayed on the wall. It's an abstract multi-colored whirlpool that winds down to a black center. Barney's min follows it down to the black nothingness...

Miriam is interviewing Barney's old friend, LEO FASOLI (6 He's now a famous painter with an air of success and grav about him. Barney and Blair watch from the booth, along with Leo's f of the month, a stunning 28 year old BIMBO.

--and we're back talking with renowned painter and artist, Leo Fasoli. Leo, you recently signed a seven figure deal with Simon and Schuster to publish your autobiography. But then you returned the money, saying you no longer wanted to do it. what happened?
It proved to be more difficult than I originally thought it would be.
In what way?  WHITE 10-23-09 103. Leo pauses.
Andre Gide, the French author, once said "nothing is as destructive to happiness as the remembrance of happiness lost".
Barney escorts Leo and his Bimbo out. A LIMO waits right outside the door. Leo lights a cigarette. For all his success, there's a sense of melancholy to him.
(to Bimbo) A spetta un minuto, cara mia.
I love it when you speak Italian. She gives Leo a kiss, then slips into the limo.
(re: Bimbo) You like this one? Leo just shrugs.
Thanks again for doing the interview. It's a real coup for Miriam.
It was my pleasure. She's an amazing woman.
Are you sure you can't stay the night? We'd love to have you over.
There's nothing I would enjoy more but I have to get back to New York. They hug.
You've made a wonderful life for yourself. It makes me happy. Leo gets in the limo and is driven away.  WHITE 10-23-09 104.
Blair has joined Barney and Miriam for dinner. Miriam and Blair enjoy lively conversation, while Barney broods in silence and polishes off another Scotch.
Allow me a toast to you Barney. You really came through getting Leo to do the interview.
Yes you did. And a toast to Blair and his new job in New York
I don't have it yet.
Here's hoping. They drink. Miriam begins to clear the table.
Let me help you.
Guests don't clean. Miriam heads to the kitchen. Long silence.
So when are you going to find out?
Probably not for another month.
A month? Jeez, don't be so soft. Push them. Let them know they'll lose you if they sit on their asses.
I'm not one to be aggressive like that.
Just because you're gay, doesn't mean you can't be assertive.
I'm not gay.
I didn't think so, but Miriam--  WHITE 10-23-09 105.
Miriam thinks I'm gay?
I told her you weren't, but-- Miriam enters.
So what you are boys talking about?
Miriam kisses Blair good-night.
Thank you for coming.
Thanks for another incredible meal, and again, congratulations, it was a fantastic interview.
Thanks. Blair exits. The moment the door closes she puts on her g face and marches into the...
...to confront Barney, who is just lighting up a cigar
What's with you? And don't say "what?". Let's just skip that whole part, okay?
I was giving him a few life lessons.
By telling him I think he's gay? And who even jokes about that anymore?
I don't want to fight about Cher
We're not fighting about Blair. We're fighting about you.
Getting Leo to come in doesn't negate all the other interviews you've missed to get drunk and watch the game, or all the dinners you've ruined because you're incorrigible with my friends.
It doesn't? Miriam is NOT amused.
I'm going to visit Michael for a week.
What? When?
Next weekend.
Okay, I'll take the week off.
No. I think a little time apart will do us both good.
What? Where is this coming from?

We've hardly been away from each other since we've been married. It'll be good for us to circulate the air in here a little. It's only a week - okay? Barney nods but he's not happy about this. Actually, he's scared to death. She gives him a kiss and exits.

BACK TO PRESENT DAY. Spring has arrived. Barney rides in a taxi. Coffee in hand. The cab stops at red light in front of the MONTREAL MUSEUM OF FINE ARTS. Barney looks out the window to see workers unraveling a DRAPERY announcing the next exposition:
ON THE DRAPERY is a PHOTO OF LEO from back in his Rome da The thought of his departed friend hits him hard. The tax pulls away.
Barney enters the office in a foul mood. The RECEPTIONIST greets him with a smile.
Good morning, Barney.
My car was stolen. Find out what I have to do to report it.
It's parked in the lot. I have the keys right here. Barney grabs the keys, walks away.
Barney slips into the soundstage just as they start rolli He's fidgety. Anxious.
A scene is playing out between O'Malley and the new, youn ditzy, SEXPOT (21), cast as the new Nurse.
I have a feeling you're going to work out just fine around here.
Oh, I won't work out here. I go to the gym for that.
And CUT! Check the gate! Solange gets up from the DIRECTOR'S CHAIR. She's now directing the show, yet still dressed in the same type of revealing, tight outfit her character would have worn.

And that everyone, completes the first episode of our 30th season! ! The whole crew bursts into applause.  WHITE 10-23-09 108. Even though it's Barney's show, the merriment around him seems to only make him more lonely and bitter. He ducks o
Barney's rifling through drawers and shelves looking for something. He's frustrated, angry. SOLANGE enters.
Why did you leave the set? I thought you might want to give a speech.
Nope. Solange stands there grinning from ear to ear, eager to t him something. Barney continues his searching.
I'm not interested.
You don't even know what I'm going to say.
I'm not interested in what you're going to say. That's the point.
What if it were something really interesting? This is annoying the hell out of him.
Right now, I'm in a state of complete disinterest to all things. Is that clear or should I have someone translate? Solange drops an AIRPLANE TICKET in front of Barney.
I'm going to Bulgaria. First Class. Barney looks at the ticket.
You haven't flown in thirty years. Barney hands her back the ticket and walks out of his off Solange follows...  WHITE 10-23-09 109.
Barney goes to the coffee machine. One of those automatic ones where you press a button and it makes you a latte He makes his choice. The machine REVS and GRINDS, forcing them to raise their voices.
I've been in systematic desensitization therapy to get over my fear of flying.

Are you out of your mind? Some idiots keep printing thirty year old pictures of you in bikinis so old Bolsheviks can have something to jerk off to and you're going to fly half way around the world because of it? What do you imagine it will be like - that you'll step off the plane right onto the tarmac, Chanel glasses, Hermes scarf wrapped around your new 'do', a gaggle of paparazzi awaiting your arrival? You're a hundred and eighty years old Solange, get over it. The coffee machine stops. Dead silence. The entire office watching them. Solange fights back tears.
What the hell is wrong with you?
With me? My friend Leo just died! Silence.
Did you hear me?!
(beat) Leo died a year ago.
(This is a replay of the OPENING OF THE MOVIE) Barney picks up the morning newspaper. Scans the front pa Something he reads upsets him.  WHITE 10-23-09 110.
Fuck.

Hi Barney.

Barney's reading the paper as he finishes his bagel and l Barney looks at his watch -- shit, he's late. Hops up to get ready. Drops the paper on the table.

You were a pallbearer at his funeral. (beat) Barney...? Off Barney's confusion --

Can I smoke in here?
hat do you think? Now be quiet and et Morty do his job.

April.

Summer .

PRE-LAP: A phone dialing, then ringing.
Scotch in hand, Barney paces while on the phone. Desperat and frantic without Miriam around.
Hello?
Michael, hi, put your mother on the phone, please.
Miriam is cleaning up clutter around Michael's apartment.
Nice to talk to you too, dad. (holding out phone) Mom. .
(into phone) Hello.
Miriam, please come home already. I can't sleep without you beside me.
I know. I keep reaching over for you in bed and--
I bought our cemetery plots today.
(beat) What?
I can't handle being without you for even a few days, and that got me thinking and, well, I just needed that settled. That we'll be together forever.
Barney...  WHITE 10-23-09 113.
I've learned my lesson. Come back tonight. Please.
I wasn't punishing you. And you shouldn't have done that without talking to me first. That's a big thing.
What does that mean? You're not sure?
Why is everything all or nothing with you? I say I need a little space, and you go out and buy real estate for our afterlife.
I'm sorry, I just--

Overreacted? Yes, you did. (beat) I'm sure what you bought is fine. What am I saying - if you bought it it's certainly the best plot in the whole city. But I'm still not coming home today. I'm enjoying my week with my son. Now I have to go, Blair is waiting for us at the restaurant. I love you--
Blair?!
Don't even start. He actually took YOUR advice and told them he had another offer. So they called him down for a final interview.
I can't believe you're there with Blair.
Barney, I'm not going to have this discussion with you. I love you but I really do have to go. Goodbye.
I love you.  WHITE 10-23-09 114. She hangs up. Barney looks around the big, empty house, going out of his mind, not knowing what to do with himsel
Barney's sitting at the bar chatting it up with Jill anda BLONDE (38) patron. He's already quite drunk.
--And so he leaves his OWN wedding and chases after her onto the train.
No way! You're crazy! Barney shrugs. Jill goes to serve another customer
You don't remember me do you?
Should I?
I had a small part on your TV show a few years ago.
Really? I'm sorry, I don't remember.

That's okay. I remembered you right away. (standing) I'm going to freshen up a bit, would you mind ordering me another? The look in her eye tells us exactly where this is going. Barney watches her walk away.
The blonde from the bar rolls off of Barney, naked, sweat and satisfied. Barney stares up at the ceiling. Too drunk and too horrified to process what he's just done.
Barney, in a state of panic, bursts into Morty's office w is eating lunch at his desk
I need a test. Now.  WHITE 10-23-09 115.
Test for what?
VD, Syphilis, Gonorrhea, AIDS--
Whoa, whoa, slow down. What the hell happened?
Just give me the test, Morty. And I need the results as soon as possible.
Driving home from the airport - a HUGE bouquet of roses w a "Welcome Home" card sits in between Barney and Miriam. Barney is conspicuously silent and nervous.
They walk in from the airport. Barney's acting strange. Both anxious and nice. Too nice.
It's good to be home.
Let me put these in water and I'll unpack your bags. Go, relax.
I have a better idea. She wraps her arms around his waist and kisses him; she's the mood for love.
I missed you.
I missed you too. He squirms out of her arms and carries the roses to the kitchen, talking from the other room.
But you must be exhausted - I'll put on some tea - and run you a bath how does that sound? She follows him into the kitchen.  WHITE 10-23-09 116.
Barney fills a GLASS VASE with water
What's wrong?
Nothing. Why?
Barney... The phone RINGS. Barney LEAPS to answer it.
Hello? Hold on... (to Miriam) It's work. Problems on the set.
When you're done hiding whatever it is you screwed up while I was gone, I'll be in the bedroom. Naked. Miriam exits. Barney takes a deep breath.
Morty, so?... oh, thank God. Thank you... okay, bye. He hangs up. He closes his eyes and remains silent and st for a long beat.
Are you off the phone?
Yes, I am. He takes another deep breath to compose himself and exits
Ready for some good lovin', Barney walks into the bedroom but stops in his tracks when he sees-- Miriam crying. The phone in her hand.
I don't know why, but I dialed star 69. You were acting so strange... She has to sit down. She's trembling. Terrified.  WHITE 10-23-09 117.
Why did you lie about it being Morty on the phone? Tell me the truth - are you sick? (beat) TELL ME.
I'm not sick.
The way you cough at night, all those cigars--
Miriam, I'm not sick.
Then what is it? What are you hiding from me? Beat.
It meant nothing to me. Miriam is completely devastated.
Please, Miriam. We have a life.
HAD a life. She storms out. Off Barney, completely shell shocked we -
PRE-LAP - A KNOCKING at the door The door opens revealing KATE, her eyes filled with tears she throws her arms around Barney and won't let go.
Easy, kiddo. (beat) Let's not mourn just yet. Morty says I've got at least a year before I'm totally bonkers. He has to gently pry her arms from around his neck.  WHITE 10-23-09 118.
Your mother's show is on. Why don't you fix us a couple drinks. You could use one. She nods - that's for sure. She starts toward the kitchen
Have you talked to her yet?
No.
Don't worry her with anything. Okay? Kate nods.
Barney's sitting at his desk. His eyes drifting over old photographs and items of nostalgia. The final bars of Leo Cohen's "I'm Your Man" playing on Miriam's radio show.

That was Leonard Cohen's "I'm Your Man" - a request from our ever faithful listener, Alphonse, all the way from Montreal. And here's one for you Alphonse - "I Don't Want To Hear It Anymore" by Dusty Springfield. Barney grins. Kate is standing in the door watching him. She steps in a hands him his drink.
Here you go, Alphonse. Barney looks at her with surprise. Kate exits.
Movers carry boxes down the hallway to the elevator. Barn steps aside to let Michael past with a box in hand. Micha won't even look at his father. We follow Barney back insi

Through the apartment and into the kitchen where Kate is helping to pack. Her eyes puffy from crying.  WHITE 10-23-09 119. Barney paces back and forth. Back and forth. Michael walks in to grab another box. He won't even look his father.
Michael, wait. (beat) I know how difficult this is for both of you, but your mother and I will work through this.
Do you even understand what you did here?
Of course.
Then how could you have fucked this up? How? She deserved so much better but she still loved you, you miserable, ungrateful prick
Watch your mouth. I'm still your father.
There's nothing I can do about that. Barney SLAPS Michael. It's so utterly shocking to both of them, that no one can move or say a word. Michael then storms out of the house.
CRASH -- Barney shatters a framed photo, tearing the room apart. Kate runs in and tries to stop him, but it's hard get past his flailing arms.
He finally stops. Kate is unsure what to do. He just stares at the TELEPHONE RECEIVER in his hand. He looks up her. His eyes filled with tears.  WHITE 10-23-09 120.
I can't remember your mother's number.
DING. The elevator doors open revealing Solange, carrying two cups of coffee. She walks down the hallway to Barney' apartment and lets herself in with a key.
She enters and sets the coffees down.
(calling out) Allo? You better be decent.

Barney's side of the closet is filled with his clothes, w the other that once held Miriam's wardrobe is completely Barney, in his best suit, is trying but unable to do his tie. His frustration finally boils over.
Goddamn it! He sees Solange in the doorway watching him.
Here, let me do it. She steps to him and does his tie. They say nothing. He won't make eye contact.
There. As handsome as you've ever been. Barney double checks the knot in the mirror.
It's time to go. She walks out first. He takes one last look in the mirror  WHITE 10-23-09 121.
Barney sitting at his table in the Ritz Garden, drinking glass of sparkling water His breath is taken away when he sees --

Miriam entering the garden. Every bit as gorgeous, elegan and graceful as she ever was. Barney sits tight, taking advantage of every second he ha to simply watch her. She sees him and smiles as she approaches the table.
You look great.
You look fantastic. They play through an awkward exchange of leaning in for a kiss, and shaking hands before Barney just takes her into his arms and hugs her. They sit.
You're not going to get sick on me again, are you?

Only coffee for me now. But I do have crib notes... (pulls out a paper) My address and number, Kate's numbers, Solange -- all the important stuff in case I get lost. I was actually thinking a dog collar might be easier She tries to laugh, but has to fight off tears instead.
I've been doing some research. They're always coming out with new treatments and trials--
Let's not do that whole thing. We all know where this is going. She nods.
We can be friends now, can't we?  WHITE 10-23-09 122.
No. We can't.
I'm here for you if you'll let me. We had a beautiful marriage, but it's over. I want you to be at peace with that.
Have I ever given up when it comes to you?
Never.
So what makes you think I would start now? Beat.
Bonjour, are you ready to hear the specials of the day?
Sure.

Barney and Miriam each have one. They grin with anticipat Miriam slices through the moist, warm chocolate sponge. Carries it past her lips and savors... Mmmm. Heaven. She opens her eyes to see-- BARNEY'S HAND hovering above his cutlery. He can't rememb which one he is supposed to use. Miriam hands him his fork.
Thank you. And they eat cake.
Would you excuse me? I have to use the ladies room?  WHITE 10-23-09 123.
Miriam crying in a stall.
Miriam returns from the washroom and is panicked when Bar is missing from the table. She races over to Jean.
Jean, did you see Barney?

No, Madame, he paid the bill, but forgot his wallet on the table. Jean hands her Barney's old, beat up WALLET. A SMALL PIECE OF PAPER is sticking out of the wallet. Wit thinking why - she pulls it out. The paper old and cracke She carefully unfolds it--
It's the note she passed to him the night they first met. He's carried this on him all these years. Seeing it liter takes her breath away.
She enters the same hall where she and Barney first met. Barney is standing there, grinning from ear to ear as if nothing is wrong.
What's wrong?
I couldn't find you, I got so scared.
It's beautiful in here isn't it?
You forgot your wallet at the table.
Look at you, you're practically shaking.
I thought I lost you.  WHITE 10-23-09 124.
Lost me? Hey, the kids are gone, why don't we go home, curl up in bed, watch a movie... Miriam cocks her head, wondering why he said that.
The kids...?

Yeah, the kids. You're the one who dropped them off at school. Are you okay? (off her crying) Oh my love, don't cry. He pulls her close. She falls into his embrace, having realized he's forgotten they ever split up.
Have I not loved you enough today? She buries her face in his neck to stop from completely breaking down.
So what do you say? Can we play hooky? She can't bring herself to shatter his fragile reality.
Let's get you home. He takes her by the arm and walks her out of the lobby, a happy as he's ever been.
OVER IMAGES of the mountain, Boogie's bones with snorkel flippers and goggles, and Barney:
